member.name: T:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Wcf.Client.WcfExceptionHandler
member.summary: This class provide handling of WCF exceptions encountered in communicating with a service fabric service that is using WCF based communication listener.
member.remarks:
The exceptions are handled as per the description below:
The following exceptions indicate service failover. These exceptions are handled by returning from the method. The property of the is set to false, the property is set to a random value up to and property is set to .
The following exceptions indicate transient error conditions and handled by returning from the method. The property of the is set to true, the property is set to a random value up to and property is set to .
The following exceptions indicate mismatch in the binding or contract between the client and the service. These exceptions are handled by returning from the method.
The following exceptions are indicate an error from the service. They are handled by returning from the method.
All other exceptions that are , but not are handled by returning from the method. The property of the is set to true, the property is set to a random value up to and property is set to .

member.summary: Method that examines the exception and determines how that exception can be handled.
member.param: Information about the exception
The operation retry preferences.
Result of the exception handling
member.returns: true if the exception is handled, false otherwise

member.name: T:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Wcf.WcfUtility
member.summary: Utility class for creating default bindings for WCF communication.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Wcf.WcfUtility.CreateTcpListenerBinding(System.Int64,System.TimeSpan,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Creates a TCP listener binding with no security for WCF communication.
member.param: Maximum size of the message in bytes. If the value is not specified or it is less than or equals to zero, a default value of 4,194,304 bytes (4 MB) is used.
Timeout for opening the connection. If the value is not specified, the default value of 5 seconds is used.
Time to wait for messages to drain on the connections before aborting the connection. If the value is not specified, the default value of 5 seconds is used.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Wcf.WcfUtility.CreateTcpClientBinding(System.Int64,System.TimeSpan,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Creates a TCP client binding with no security for WCF communication.
member.param: Maximum size of the message in bytes. If the value is not specified or it is less than or equals to zero, a default value of 4,194,304 bytes (4 MB) is used.
Timeout for opening the connection. If the value is not specified, the default value of 5 seconds is used.
Time to wait for messages to drain on the connections before aborting the connection. If the value is not specified, the default value of 5 seconds is used.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Wcf.Client.WcfCommunicationClientFactory`1
member.summary: An that uses Windows Communication Foundation to create to communicate with stateless and stateful services that are using .
Constructs a factory to create clients using WCF to communicate with the services.
member.param: WCF binding to use for the client. If the client binding is not specified or null, a default client binding is created using method which creates a with no security.
Exception handlers to handle the exceptions encountered in communicating with the service.
Service partition resolver to resolve the service endpoints. If not specified, a default service partition resolver returned by is used.
Id to use in diagnostics traces from this component.
The callback client that receives the callbacks from the service.

Cancellation token

member.summary: Returns true if the client is still valid. Connection oriented transports can use this method to indicate that the client is no longer connected to the service.
member.param: WCF communication client
member.returns: true if the client is valid, false otherwise

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Wcf.Client.WcfCommunicationClientFactory`1.ValidateClient(System.String,Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Wcf.Client.WcfCommunicationClient{`0})
member.summary: Returns true if the client is still valid and connected to the endpoint specified in the parameter.
member.param: endpoint string
WCF communication client
member.returns: true if the client is valid, false otherwise

member.name: T:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Wcf.Runtime.WcfCommunicationListener`1
member.summary: A Windows Communication Foundation based listener for Service Fabric based stateless or stateful service.
member.typeparam: Type of the WCF service contract.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Wcf.Runtime.WcfCommunicationListener`1.#ctor(System.Fabric.ServiceContext,`0)
member.summary: Constructs a WCF based communication listener that uses default binding and default endpoint address.
member.param: The context of the service for which this communication listener is being constructed.
WCF service implementing the specified WCF service contract.

remarks.para: The default listener binding is created using method.

The default endpoint address is created using the endpoint resource defined in the service manifest. The name of the endpoint resource is derived from the WCF service contract type using method. If matching endpoint resource is not found in the service manifest, a default endpoint resource definition with port zero is used.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Wcf.Runtime.WcfCommunicationListener`1.#ctor(System.Fabric.ServiceContext,`0,System.ServiceModel.Channels.Binding,System.String)
member.summary: Constructs a WCF based communication listener that uses specified listener binding and endpoint address derived from the specified endpoint resource name.
member.param: The context of the service for which this communication listener is being constructed.
WCF service implementing the specified WCF service contract.
The binding to use for the WCF endpoint. If the listenerBinding is not specified or it is null, a default listener binding is created using method.

The name of the endpoint resource defined in the service manifest that should be used to create the address for the listener. If the endpointResourceName is not specified or it is null, it's name is derived from the WCF service contract type using method. If matching endpoint resource is not found in the service manifest, a default endpoint resource definition with port zero is used.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Wcf.Runtime.WcfCommunicationListener`1.#ctor(System.Fabric.ServiceContext,`0,System.ServiceModel.Channels.Binding,System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress)
member.summary: Constructs a WCF based communication listener that uses specified listener binding and endpoint address derived from the specified endpoint address.
member.param: The context of the service for which this communication listener is being constructed.
WCF service implementing the specified WCF service contract.
The binding to use for the WCF endpoint. If the listenerBinding is not specified or it is null, a default listener binding is created using method.

The listen address for the WCF endpoint. if the address is not specified or it is null, a default address is created by looking up the endpoint resource from the service manifest. The endpoint resource name is derived from the WCF service contract type using method. If matching endpoint resource is not found in the service manifest, a default endpoint resource definition with port zero is used.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Wcf.Runtime.WcfCommunicationListener`1.Microsoft#ServiceFabric#Services#Communication#Runtime#ICommunicationListener#OpenAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: This method causes the communication listener to be opened. Once the Open completes, the communication listener becomes usable - accepts and sends messages.
member.param: Cancellation token
member.returns: A Task that represents outstanding operation. The result of the Task is the endpoint string.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Wcf.Runtime.WcfCommunicationListener`1.Microsoft#ServiceFabric#Services#Communication#Runtime#ICommunicationListener#CloseAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: This method causes the communication listener to close. Close is a terminal state and this method allows the communication listener to transition to this state in a graceful manner.
member.param: Cancellation token
member.returns: A Task that represents outstanding operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Wcf.Runtime.WcfCommunicationListener`1.Microsoft#ServiceFabric#Services#Communication#Runtime#ICommunicationListener#Abort
member.summary: This method causes the communication listener to close. Close is a terminal state and this method causes the transition to close ungracefully. Any outstanding operations (including close) should be canceled when this method is called.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Wcf.Runtime.WcfCommunicationListener`1.ServiceHost
member.summary: Gets the used by this listener to host the WCF service implementation.
member.value: A used by this listener to host the WCF service implementation.
member.remarks: The service host is created by the listener in it's constructor. Before this communication listener is opened by the runtime via method, the service host can be customized by accessing it via this property.

member.summary:
Creates a service remoting client factory that can be used by the
to create a proxy for the remoted interface of the service.
member.param: Client implementation where the callbacks should be dispatched.

member.summary: Gets or Sets the max message size that can be transferred over remoting.
member.value: The max message size that can be transferred over remoting

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.Wcf.WcfServiceRemotingProviderAttribute.OpenTimeoutInMilliSeconds
member.summary: Gets or Sets the timeout in milliseconds for opening the connection from client side and waiting for the listener to open on the service side.
member.value: The timeout in milliseconds for opening the connection from client side and waiting for the listener to open on the service side.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.Wcf.WcfServiceRemotingProviderAttribute.CloseTimeoutInMilliSeconds
member.summary: Gets or Sets the timeout in milliseconds to wait before closing the connection to let existing messages drain.
member.value: The timeout in milliseconds to wait before closing the connection to let existing messages drain.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.Wcf.Client.WcfServiceRemotingClientFactory
member.summary: An that uses Windows Communication Foundation to create to communicate with stateless and stateful services over interfaces that are remoted via .
Constructs a WCF based service remoting client factory.
member.param: WCF binding to use for the client. If the client binding is not specified or null, a default client binding is created using method which creates a with no security.
The callback client that receives the callbacks from the service.
Exception handlers to handle the exceptions encountered in communicating with the service.
Service partition resolver to resolve the service endpoints. If not specified, a default service partition resolver returned by is used.
Id to use in diagnostics traces from this component.
Delegate function that creates using the .
member.remarks: This factory uses and in addition to the exception handlers supplied to the constructor.

member.param: Uri of the service to resolve
Key that identifies the partition to resolve
Specifies which replica in the partition identified by the partition key, the client should connect to
Specifies which listener in the endpoint of the chosen replica, to which the client should connect to
Specifies the retry policy that should be used for exceptions that occur when creating the client.
Cancellation token
member.returns: A Task that represents outstanding operation. The result of the Task is the CommunicationClient() object.

member.param: Previous ResolvedServicePartition value
Specifies which replica in the partition identified by the partition key, the client should connect to
Specifies which listener in the endpoint of the chosen replica, to which the client should connect to
Specifies the retry policy that should be used for exceptions that occur when creating the client.
Cancellation token
member.returns: A Task that represents outstanding operation. The result of the Task is the CommunicationClient() object.

member.summary: Handles the exceptions that occur in the CommunicationClient when sending a message to the Service
member.param: Communication client
Information about exception that happened while communicating with the service.
Specifies the retry policy that should be used for handling the reported exception.
Cancellation token
member.returns: A Task that represents outstanding operation. The result of the Task is a object that provides information on retry policy for this exception.

member.name: E:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.Wcf.Client.WcfServiceRemotingClientFactory.ClientConnected
member.summary: Event handler that is fired when a client is connected to the service endpoint.

member.name: E:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.Wcf.Client.WcfServiceRemotingClientFactory.ClientDisconnected
member.summary: Event handler that is fired when a client is disconnected from the service endpoint.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.Wcf.Runtime.WcfServiceRemotingListener
member.summary: An that uses Windows Communication Foundation to provide interface remoting for stateless and stateful services.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.Wcf.Runtime.WcfServiceRemotingListener.#ctor(System.Fabric.ServiceContext,Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.IService,System.ServiceModel.Channels.Binding,System.String)
member.summary: Constructs a WCF based service remoting listener.
member.param: The context of the service for which the remoting listener is being constructed.
The service implementation object.
WCF binding to use for the listener. If the listener binding is not specified or null, a default listener binding is created using method which creates a with no security.

The name of the endpoint resource defined in the service manifest that should be used to create the address for the listener. If the endpointResourceName is not specified or null, the default value "ServiceEndpoint" is used.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.Wcf.Runtime.WcfServiceRemotingListener.#ctor(System.Fabric.ServiceContext,Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.Runtime.IServiceRemotingMessageHandler,System.ServiceModel.Channels.Binding,System.String)
member.summary: Constructs a WCF based service remoting listener.
member.param: The context of the service for which the remoting listener is being constructed.
The handler for receiving and processing remoting messages. As the messages are received the listener delivers the messages to the handler.
WCF binding to use for the listener. If the listener binding is not specified or null, a default listener binding is created using method which creates a with no security.

The name of the endpoint resource defined in the service manifest that should be used to create the address for the listener. If the endpointResourceName is not specified or it is null, the default value "ServiceEndpoint" is used.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.Wcf.Runtime.WcfServiceRemotingListener.#ctor(System.Fabric.ServiceContext,Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.Runtime.IServiceRemotingMessageHandler,System.ServiceModel.Channels.Binding,System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress)
member.summary: Constructs a WCF based service remoting listener.
member.param: The context of the service for which the remoting listener is being constructed.
The handler for receiving and processing remoting messages. As the messages are received the listener delivers the messages to the handler.
WCF binding to use for the listener. If the listener binding is not specified or null, a default listener binding is created using method.

The endpoint address to use for the WCF listener. If not specified or null, the endpoint address is created using the default endpoint resource named "ServiceEndpoint" defined in the service manifest.
